Race.SpecificTitle: Law Enforcement District -- 1/2% S&U Tax - Sheriff
Race.FullText: Shall the Law Enforcement District of the Parish of Winn, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one-half of one percent (1/2%) (the "Tax"), (an estimated $900,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), in perpetuity, from and after January 1, 2014, upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the District, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) to be dedicated and used for the purpose of providing additional support for the Winn Parish Sheriff's Department (the "Department"), including but not limited to, acquiring, improving, maintaining and operating law enforcement facilities, vehicles and equipment and funding general operations of the Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School Board -- 8.07 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Winn, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), through the Winn Parish School Board, the governing authority thereof for school purposes, continue to levy a special tax of eight and seven hundredths (8.07) mills on all property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $500,340 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of providing funds for maintenance and operation of the public schools of the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: Cons. School Dist. No. 11 -- 3 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Consolidated School District No. 11 Proposition
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated School District No. 11 of the Parish of Winn, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of three (3) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $38,400 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of acquiring, improving, maintaining, operating and supporting public schools and school facilities, equipment and programs in and for the District?
